name: plato_single_variant
title: PLATO - Single Variant Analysis
summary: The PLatform for the Analysis, Translation, and Organization of large-scale data (PLATO)

inputSpec.name: input_plink_binarys
inputSpec.label: PLINK binary input files (bed, bim, fam)
inputSpec.help: A list of files with PLINK's binary fileset to be referenced.

inputSpec.name: phenotypes_tsv
inputSpec.label: Input phenotype file
inputSpec.help: A file, with phenotype information recorded.

inputSpec.name: regression
inputSpec.label: Regression
inputSpec.help: A string describing the type of regression applied for the analysis.

inputSpec.name: association_type
inputSpec.label: Association Type
inputSpec.help: A string describing which type of association analysis is performed. If selected "PheWAS", PLATO will use all traits not explicity excluded or used as covariates as outcomes.

inputSpec.name: outcome
inputSpec.label: Outcome (Only required if Assocaition Type: GWAS)
inputSpec.help: (Optional) A comma-separated list of traits to use as outcomes for the regression models when "GWAS" is selected as the type of association analysis.

inputSpec.name: covariates
inputSpec.label: Covariates (Enter covariates column names)
inputSpec.help: (Optional) A comma-separated list of traits to include as covariates in each model. Covariates given in this argument are premuted along with the phenotypic status when permutation testing is performed; for this reason, this argument should include phenotypic control variables such as age and gender.

inputSpec.name: split_phenotype
inputSpec.label: Phenotype per job
inputSpec.help: (Optional) Number of phenotype to run in each sub job.

inputSpec.name: output_filename
inputSpec.label: Output Filename
inputSpec.help: (Optional) A string, with the expected output file name.

inputSpec.name: plato_analysis_string
inputSpec.label: PLATO command-line options
inputSpec.help: (Optional) Extra command line options that will be supplied directly to the PLATO execution. If used, leave above Regression Options EMPTY.

inputSpec.name: missingness
inputSpec.label: Enter value used to denote missingness in phenotype or covariate input files
inputSpec.help: A string, used to treat as a missing value. This is especially helpful when missing data is represented by a valid number that is nonsensical in the context of the variables being loaded (e.g. "-9999" as a value for BMI).

inputSpec.name: input_continuous_covariate_txt
inputSpec.label: Continuous Covariate
inputSpec.help: (Optional) A file, with continuous covariate information; values must be continuous numeric.

inputSpec.name: input_categorical_covariate_txt
inputSpec.label: Categorical Covariates
inputSpec.help: (Optional) Here entry of non-numeric classes are allowedand will automatically generate a dummy encoding.

inputSpec.name: input_samples_txt
inputSpec.label: Sample file
inputSpec.help: (Optional) User-specified list of sample ID's to include in the analysis. The file format should be a space/tab-delimited text file with family IDs (FID) in the first column and individual IDs (IID) in the second column.

inputSpec.name: input_markers_txt
inputSpec.label: SNP file
inputSpec.help: (Optional) User-specified list of SNPs to include in the analysis. The file format should be either one `RSID` per line or positions in rage format (chr start stop label).

inputSpec.name: maf_threshold
inputSpec.label: MAF Threshold
inputSpec.help: (Optional) A float, with the filtering threshold of minor allele frequency.

inputSpec.name: case_threshold
inputSpec.label: Case Threshold
inputSpec.help: (Optional) A integer, with the min number of cases threshold.

inputSpec.name: correction
inputSpec.label: Correction Type
inputSpec.help: (Optional) A string, with the description on which of multiple test correction strategies to use in reporting results from the regression.
